{"step_by_step_thinking": "Scaphocephaly is a condition characterized by a long, narrow head shape. The relevant documents consistently mention that scaphocephaly is caused by the premature fusion of the sagittal suture. The sagittal suture is the suture that runs from the front to the back of the head. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Sagittal suture.", "answer_choice": "B"}
